We thoroughly enjoyed the food.  As a bonus, there are multiple televisions, all on different channels, so you can catch a game or catch up on national news while you dine.

QZNLJ68kuS51Tlqljvf3ow.review_text: I had breakfast at the Hyatt hotel restaurant, Knuckles, in the morning. Service was EXCELLENT, and the food was awesome.....I had 3 pieces of french toast from the buffet.  1 two eggs sunny side up, sausage, wheat toast 14.00 1 juice 4.00 1 coffee 4.00 1 regular buffet 18.00  Total - $43.80

Nz0fiE3wV_EfFCmEABvqQw.review_text: Bottom line? Food was good, service was sub par and for the price we should have gone elsewhere.   Now the background, I'm staying in town across the street at the Holiday Inn Express a group of five of us had just gotten off the plane and checked in.  We're hungry and we see Knuckles and figure we'll just eat there because we have a meeting in a couple hours.  We walk in and the place looks nice, my first thought? Food should be good but may be a bit pricey.  Looking around we see one couple, it is around 2pm and we're after a late lunch so it shouldn't be too busy.  Five of us order our food, wait and talk. A family of three comes in, orders and waits as well.  Bit of time goes by and the family of three gets their meals served and begins eating. Bit more time and we get ours. The family of three finishes and leaves before we finish.  And the food?  It was good. It's what to be expected from a nice looking place. But... The orders came out wrong. Our server seemed to have mixed parts of orders up with each of ours. And she was even writing it all down!  Two of us sitting on the end ordered the "build a burger" plate and ended up with a mixture of each other's order. Another asked for sweet potato fries instead of regular and ended up with the regular.  Drinks were not filled or topped off unless asked.  I would have understood the  errors if it were busy or we ordered complex custom meals... But we didn't and it the five of us made up half the customers at the time.

SDUjVwy2S57aae6lhyTy7A.review_text: Ok, my first impression of this place was good (different from all other reviews) because I had a decent salad for a late lunch.     However, since we are guest of the hotel, we had two more meals.  Terrible service all three times and food was bland, boring and tasteless.  Here's the summary:  Cobb salad was very good, but lacked acid...needed citrus. They used romaine lettuce and dressing was a fresh mustard vinegarette.   Decent and I did enjoy it.  Service was off-hand at best.    Nachos - a big pile of goop, low quality chips and just uninspired in any way, execution or content.   Petrale sole and mashed potatoes - downright unappetizing, smelled extremely fishy and my husband did not like any of it.   Breakfast - RUN! Don't go here. Tasteless and awful. Even the fruit was not ripe. I ordered eggs basted and they were actually filled with water!  Waited 15 minutes after asking for a coffee refill and water.   Everyone is correct, the service is propably the worst I've seen in a while. These people are clueless.  Very inexperienced and do NOT act happy to be helping/waiting on you.  Exception is the nice hostess at the front.   Positives are - the decor is very cool, typical Hyatt...very classy but mod.  Love the room the restaurant is in - very light and open, beautiful.  It is a crime to be in San Franscico and eat here for anything other than late lunch or desperation.

TKKGVe_GVYOv5_-Kme6IgQ.review_text: Nachos are amazing... especially with chicken. Service has improved compared to when it was a Sports Bar..... during my meal, the waiter came up to my table and asked if I like the BBQ Chicken (I did) and invited me back and gave me a suggestion. The experience solely based on the waiters invite back felt really good and felt that my business was appreciated. I think the number of TVs decreased but if you sit in a booth, you get your personal one.... not sure if you can change the channel, but its still nice!

Rmua_ncEG9aCguqLcXgQbg.review_text: Nice, elegant interiors.  Friendly staff and delicious food.  I had the Shrimp Salad and Salmon with Noodles for my entree.... I loved it!  A place where you get your money's worth.

POPkY1dgdQ4avdRazaCorQ.review_text: I really liked this place. We happen to walk past it on our way to our boat ride in the Bay. All I saw was a big baseball on a sign, and I think we walked all the way around the block to find it. It is in the Hyatt (I think), this place is really cool. We were there like at 1pm and their happy hour does not start until 4pm...just like most places in SF. My wife and I had 2-3 beers each and they were $5.00 each. Not bad for a hotel bar close to Fisherman's Wharf. Rick the bartender said happy hour was half off which would have been really cool if we stopped by later. Rick was really cool. We were close to the only people in the bar at that time and he talked to us for like an hour. We talked about us being on vacation and going to the baseball game the next day. He told stories of when he used to smoke (cigarettes) and other cool bars to go to close to our hotel. There were TVs all over that place and it looked like even the booths had their own TV that you can change the channel.  When we were about to leave, we mentioned were we could get a good bottle of Cali wine to bring home as a gift and he not only told of us of a few places but he also gave us a few things from the bar, like small key chains, a beer bucket (which came in handy as we picked up gifts for everyone) and a few other things he had laying around. I think he was the best and coolest bartender we had while in SF. We will definitely be back when we are in town.

zqyV61vOYChvQ4aZNiLiJQ.review_text: Good fish and chips.  Clayton the bartender is a real pro. A pleasure to be around.  Fun place.

IKX74jdqvuUQRJm4G_JkOQ.review_text: Wow!  What a great find!  Random hotel "sports" bar, but more of a slick modern open and welcoming new fair restaurant.  Great service by Mary Jane, which included stellar mojito to order.  Got the roasted chicken tortilla soup.  Oh em ge!  Amaze.  This is not cream based, which I confirmed before order as that's not only bad for YOU, but loaded in extra calories.  Anyhow, it's tomato based, and served in a small carafe  that is poured into the bowl, where the tortilla strips, onions and a few other goodies await.  It was thick, tasty and the right temp.  A must get!  Followed up by the chicken quesadilla.  Uniquely served really as two soft tacos, upright with the tortilla crisped with melted cheese and chicken and condiment sides that you add on your own: pico, guac, sour.

bLbSNkLggFnqwNNzzq-Ijw.review_text: If your bar advertises advertises via a banner on the street that it is a good place to watch the game, and features 16 tv screens showing various sports, you would think there would be game day or game-time drink specials, right? Well, not if you're owned by Hyatt! Found this bar via our GPS and didn't realize it was a hotel bar until later. Regardless, charging $6 minimum for draft domestic is downright unamerican! And it tasted watered down.  Food and service weren't much better- our server, Boris, did not clear a plate or cup from our table for over three hours, nor did he refill any water glasses at the table until specifically asked to do so. Flagging him down to place orders took an average of 15 minutes.  Fish and chips with garlic fries was decent. The mussels appetizer had a great white wine sauce, but was inexplicably served with several pieces of toast- what on earth is that about? Last order, the buffalo chicken pizza, was a total waste- chicken appeared to be microwaved frozen popcorn style, but there was no "buffalo" anything to be found on the cracker like crust. Bland at best.   Wont return or recommend bar or hotel largely due to lack of quality and customer service, not to mention deplorable bathroom conditions.

_S5tB9stFX3YKLBPVoEjqA.review_text: went here once for football and it sucked. the only reason im giving 2 stars is because they had an incredible amount of plasma's. the negative was that, based on where you were sitting, it was hard to watch the game that you wanted to see. my other beef with this place was that they were only serving breakfast for the morning games. why would i want pancakes with my beer? why would you not allow people to order wings or fries at 10am? places like jillian's are 10 times better on a sunday or saturday for football...

B_Via1bKGdvbxcOfd988EQ.review_text: Came to Knuckles about 15 minutes before they closed to take a birthday shot with my best friend at midnight. At first they were rushing to get us out of there but then a server said he would take care of us and let us sit down to order shots only because we had to leave before 12. My shot of patron was warm but it was pretty big! They didn't have pineapple juice to chase but oh well. The decor was so cute! Can only rate on the 15 minutes I was there but the staff was friendly and we were able to celebrate my friend's birthday.

QMg-26KtQQgUR5DXe1AH-Q.review_text: Bartender was an A+. Sports on the TV is an A+. Drinks are an A+. Food is horrible horrible horrible.  Go for the drinks, NOT for the food.

Pfsi-rKQBHwBlsQsVbXiFw.review_text: I loved the food, especially the crab cakes.  They were the best crab cakes I've ever eaten!!  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  Good time!

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Like a way-overpriced Denny's that threw up a sports bar.

zHptMS7T1FJr4NohqW-jOQ.review_text: Sports bar with plenty of comfort food and wide drink selection.   Nothing uniquely San Francisco about the place if you are from out of town, but it you are tired and need a reliable place for a good meal I'd recommend stopping here.  Service was good and prompt. In our case we'd been out site seeing all day and had gotten caught in the rain a few time. We were looking for a place to relax and restore our energy and Knuckles did the trick.

xUNFuuySOiVQG6OAOsqZYA.review_text: It's trench warfare getting a table for yourself at this place.  Go during a crowded hour and bring your best weapons.   $12 per drink, woooaaahhhhh. The service is unfriendly. Likely won't be back.

TCeBrXFtW4H2lHdyriSZVg.review_text: This place is awesome !!! I went there at three different occasions. I was staying at a nearbye hotel, and we went there first  for dinner. I had the special, it looks like it most of the time fish or seafood oriented since they are part of the seafood alliance (sustainable seafood program... TO BE COMMENDED...) it just did not taste only fantastic, but I was able to watch my game  !!! I found out that they do breakfast as well, we came back in the morning, and I was in shcoked that they were able to top off my experience from the night before... Breakfast buffet ALL YOU CAN EAT, with a cook that make your omelet in front of you, and it was sooooo good !! The staff was awesome, they gave us a whole itinerary of things to do in SF,... No need for concierge... We came back in the afternoon for drinks, everyone recognized us, we felt that we already were regular, they remembered what I was drinking the night before, they change the channel to my favorite sport.... UNFORGETTABLE !!!!  Thank you Knuckles !!

flUL-Ecy5AKzqlKxL3O8jw.review_text: We stayed at the Hyatt and subsequently at at Knuckles for breakfast a couple of times.  We had the buffet and it was a good hotel buffet.  There was a good variety and they kept the food trays pretty well stocked so everything was fresh and overall pretty tasty.  It was nice to have the chef at the omelet station.  The restaurant was clean and the service was not bad, the staff was friendly just not as attentive as they could have been.

rNGz8UXU8x94h8x4E8P3OA.review_text: We went here 2x last weekend.  Once one a Friday night and then on Super Bowl Sunday 2013... Friday was meh and Sunday was a blast!  Here is my mixed review...  LOCATION & AMBIANCE:  The bar is connected to the Hyatt, so there was many tourists (I'm guessing, but also have met with many).  The restaurant/bar has two entrances, one from the outside and one to the hotel.  The bathroom is in the hotel lobby, just outside of the entrance to the restaurant.  There is a wine bar on the way to the hotel as well.  On a Friday night, it was empty.  On Super Bowl Sunday, it was packed and the crowd got hyped (in part due to my husband's yelling and getting the crowd going haha).  There are a lot of TV's around the place... see my notes on service though with our experience of the 2nd TV in our booth.  And booths, there are a few of them, but not a lot.  SERVICE:  I'd like to note that because Knuckles was at our hotel (the Hyatt) and because we pre-planned our trip to SF back in October, we intended to watch the Super Bowl here no matter what.  I even emailed the concierge for the hotel to attempt a reservation, but never got a reply.  The day after the 49'ers won the division to make it to the super bowl, we called directly (# from Yelp is correct, not on the website for the hotel/restaurant, FYI!) and I got hooked up with Jennifer Goodson, who began coordinating with us immediately.  She was great in ensuring we got a table large enough for our group and even took pictures of the booth we reserved for the game.  (We had a group of 9-11 people and she wanted to ensure we knew the space we'd have.)  Before I disucss Sunday, I'd like to briefly mention my Friday experience, when I called down from my hotel room to discuss food and they said I had 7 minutes to order; less than 5 minutes later, I called down for to go and they didn't answer.  We got downstairs at 11:01 pm and was told by the bartender the kitchen staff "wouldn't even serve food to their own mothers at this time."  So, he made a recommendation and we prepared on our way.  As I passed the booth I knew we'd have, I asked the server if I could ask a question and he responded "you just did."  Hmph... I asked another one anyway. ;-)  Then to Sunday... Since Jennifer did say there were two TV's and I saw them Friday, I felt fine with our booth.  Unfortunately, upon arrival, they didn't have the 2nd going and two employees made brief attempts to make one work, but then quickly gave up.  It wasn't until into the 2nd half of the football game that I met Jennifer and she began getting others on to it... 5 people/attempts later, it finally was going which made the experience WAY BETTER.  (Previous to that, half of us were stretching our necks to watch or viewing it backwards through the mirror.)  Now, our server was Boris and I thought he was just OK, getting the job done.  He was super busy though, and I do realize that could have contributed to the attention he gave us (or lack thereof, especially initially), but he also asked us not to allow other staff (who came to our table) take our orders.  It was a little odd.  We did comply though and let others fill water or take plates, but not take orders.  I'd add that my husband said he enjoyed Boris as our server and got his dry humor; so I can't dock him too much, but I thought that was weird.  And we realized later he was the same guy from Friday night who said "you just did."  I'd also like to add that there was another employee, Joana (pronounced Jo-Wanna, not Jo-Anna), who was very nice and helpful.  We thought she was great.  FOOD & DRINKS:  They have a full bar and had pitchers around $20 each, so that was good.  They ran out of the Magners after I ordered my 1st one and then didn't have any Angry Orchard, despite having an ad for it on the table.  Kind of a bummer on my birthday, but whateh.  The cocktails were mixed well and that worked for our post-game, end of the night drinks.  The nachos were weird with cheese that was not your normal, but not as bad as I expected per Yelp reviews; I do agree with the chicken comments though.  The flatbread w/pesto and shrimp was yum, as well as many of the deserts (think Pizookie for those of you who go to BJ's restaurants).  The wings were OK and the fries were well liked.    Bottom Line(s) - They don't serve food after 11pm.  The service is OK to decent.  And it is a bar at the hotel with plenty of TV's, so its more of a tourist spot than a local one.  Convenience is sometimes key... and that did it for us.  Would I return? If I stayed at the hotel.  Would I go out of my way otherwise?  Not likely.

WGVRnbgyxQL4FLZpXf7uXw.review_text: While visiting in SF several weeks ago, together with my partner, we wanted the opportunity to view several out-of-town MLB games as well as the Giants (even though they were playing at AT&T).   Being an -out-of-towner we checked Yelp for your advices....in fact, unfortunately, our hotel concierge was not sure 'where' or 'what' location would offer mutli-screen viewing capabilities near our hotel. We decided to take all-of-your-review advices and give it a try. We were NOT disappointed.....all we wanted was video, hopefully good food and drink. We lucked out.  Upon arriving, the host directed us to a center-area table but we saw that there were several 'private' booths with individual wall mounted monitors. The booths can comfortably seat up to 6 adults....but as there was just the 2 of us, the host obliged and we got exactly what we were hoping for. The host then gave us a channel selector and we honed in on the Giants game. Further, the advantage of the booth meant that we would have less distraction from other patrons.   Our waiters were quite prompt. We placed our bar-order (Coronas) and were provided same within minutes. Our food order included chicken wings, burgers and crab cakes. All was served well, enjoyable and priced moderately. Our total tab did not exceed 100.00 including tip prior to the end of the evening.  If you are looking for a rawcus (spelling) setting, this is NOT it. If you are looking for a pleasant and inviting location for sports viewing, a full bar, comfortable seating, friendly and attentive staff - and the ability to chat with your fellow guests while viewing and eating - Knuckles meets and exceeds that scenario. It's location, near Fisherman's Wharf, allows you to take any public transportation as we did.   Thumbs Up: 4+ on all points. Good show, Knuckles.

t5nlOwDHJibXGPFetmrxGg.review_text: "And then he went there. He ordered a vodka rocks and proceeded to try and pick up on a single traveling woman musician in the corner..."  Knuckles in the Hyatt at the Wharf is what is it. "That has got to be the worst food that I've ever had!" is all my colleague could mumble through his fistful of French toast. "You're a Yelp foodie! How can you eat this stuff?" more muffled mumbles. Hmmm. He wasn't saying that the day before when we dragged our tired travel feet up to the bar and he proceeded to order a vodka rocks. Which, is my point. It's really a sports bar that's attached to a hotel. You don't go to a pancake house for a scotch and soda, so why would you go to a sports bar expecting a great breakfast? Or, a great anything if it doesn't pair with a frosty beer? And, I might add, I counted 23 godzilla screen TV's.   Frankly, I thought the breakfast was decent. The scrambled eggs were cooked right, the bacon was well balanced with marbling; even the dollar sized pancakes hit the right spot...for what it was. C'mon. It's a sports bar that cooks a decent meal, served by staff who smile even though they're likely to never see your face again.   And, after checking out of the Hyatt, I zipped-in for an iced tea (not the Long Island kind), and the lunch fare seemed equally paired in quality with the breakfast. Fresh looking burgers and fries. Nice looking bowls of chowder. Why would you care anyway if your eyes are glued to one of the 23+ TV's? For all you know, you could be eating the brochure.  Frankly, I think my colleague did.   And then he went there. He ordered a vodka rocks and proceeded to try and pick up on a single traveling woman musician in the corner. Come to think of it, he did eat my brochure. I can't find it.

lp2f1viw61OKUTs7z08ecQ.review_text: Knuckles is a nice restaurant at the Hyatt, but the prices are a little expensive for what you get.  The food was fresh, service was good and there was never a line or wait to get to a booth.  I would recommend to go across the street if you want double the portions for half the price.

Shb446T7icILAkLqdenFgA.review_text: Thank goodness I was with great company because there was nothing pleasant about this restaurant.  We had a large group and we had at least 2 waitresses helping us.  Unfortunately the service was lacking.  We didn't get checked on often enough for a group our size. Some food served was uncooked and food wasn't spectacular.  Sometimes if food isn't all that, service can make up for it but we didn't get either.

BvxT2kV1c_-a0ypnsTmUdg.review_text: Considering all the great options at Fisherman's Wharf, I wasn't expecting much from this hotel restaurant at the Hyatt, but I must admit to being pleasantly surprised. The dining room is spacious, and the wall of TV's behind the bar makes for a first class sports bar. The food  was good though we only had sliders, nachos, and stuffed mushrooms. The happy hour appetizers are an especially good value. All in all a very enjoyable and relaxing experience if you're looking to stay close to the hotel.

X8Xxpq0z-4mfuOvHvy4VRw.review_text: HORRIBLE. Don't call yourself a "sports bar". Bad food, poor service-inexperienced management, supposed sports bar TV's not properly placed to conveniently watch games unless your right at the bar (trying to make you buy drinks over food).  Came here to watch my GIANTS games...I thought this place was bad before the remodel and came back hoping they would improve the overall experience. NOT  I wish I could give them no stars!

Nh8z4V_OT9mEprDoL7Oqeg.review_text: Went there for breakfast on a whim. Ordered eggs, sausage, potatoes, and pancakes. Awful food and terrible service. Plus, way overpriced, orange juice was 4 dollars and total bill was 50 dollars DO NOT GO FOR BREAKFAST should have just stood in line at Hollywood Café

wb_N5rbsl-wXQHd0thlvJw.review_text: Went to Knuckles with a restaurant.com certificate yesterday. I havent been there before so I didnt care what it used to be, or is supposed to be, or whatever. Its a bar and restaurant with great daytime lighting and high ceilings, a nice bartender, and good food. On a Saturday afternoon it was not busy at all so we got fast service. We ordered two drinks and three appetizers for the two of us. The crab cakes, stuffed mushrooms, and calamari were all delivered within 10 minutes, and there are like 23 tvs in this place, and the booths have their own tvs! just like fuckin vegas.. mm .. vegas. I will visit again. Thank you cute bartender!

WwB6wB0ad3s-WJc9p7gfVQ.review_text: We came here for happy hour on a Friday night - ordered the specials: wine and calamari. The atmosphere is nice and it has a lot of TVs for sports fans. The wine was so-so but the calamari is pretty nice - not too much batter and the sauce is delicious.

yWnXP1N0klollvqjDunFtQ.review_text: Chowder was the best I've had in San Francisco. Would have been better with a bit of bread. Fish and chips were good. It's away from the crowds and worth a look. Service was on point. I will eat here next time I'm in town.

-UMfTNkO8X_U1Sqy8R5ciA.review_text: Good for watching sports, lots of TVs. Terrible service. We had a $200 minimum table for the Super Bowl and they forgot our food order not once, but twice. Food was alright, a bit bland. It was mainly the service (or lack thereof) that really got me to write this review.

FRLHsMaXlVg9C4G4tO7GpQ.review_text: I went there for breakfast. they also have buffet. breakfast time ends at 11 which is not a good thing for weekends.price is a bit high considering the size of food you get and also other restaurants in the area, crab cake benedict was good. waitress was so friendly.

fosVI_oCEpWvM7ax9NhhnQ.review_text: The place looks amazing!!! Plenty of TV's to watch games. Good food but kinda high priced.  They had post some specials posted, but when I asked for one the waiter said it was unavailable. He then removed the sign ???? Never seen this move before. Was there to watch a game or probably would have left.  Still well worth checking out.

11KzEQy1MPaD8iS4yV_Axw.review_text: I recently stayed at the Hyatt and ate here twice - once for breakfast...once for dinner. The breakfast buffet was good.  The bacon wasn't over cooked and it wasn't undercooked, it was juuusssstttt right.  The other items like eggs, blueberry pancakes, local fruits and cheeses made it really good.  I'm not sure if it was worth $23, but it's nice breakfast in a nice hotel in an uber touristy area so those are the expectations. The dinner of fish & chips was less expensive,  but not as enjoyable.  My fish was british style (not Vander Kemps wedges), but it was over cooked and burnt - the chips were meh. The service was great though.  The place has a good beer selection and I got to taste a couple beers before choosing and everyone was super nice.  I would eat here again, but not get the fish and chips. Also, if you are ever at the wharf and needing to get way from the crowds and over crazy priced food and out of the sun, it's a good place to go.

awwKA-2LsAgv4cSn38APhQ.review_text: Service was attentive and appropriate Lots of screens and windows  Fish and Chips were a disappointment Is there such a thing as dead tasting chips and batter that sucks the fun out of the fish and chip experience?  On this day in my opinion yes.

0M5AAPNb9QYbCHp0bDrbGg.review_text: Rude staff and extremely slow service! Food is over price for the quality. I'd pass as I know I won't be back for dinner. The manager took 50% off our meal but all I wanted was our food. Excuse was everyone came at the same time and the servers got nervous?? Really?

TourOK1mfKXwwTqtmwmOkw.review_text: If somehow you are in a serious bind and you can not leave the hotel for food, eat here. Otherwise, there are 9 billion other places you should be eating on the Wharf. They screwed up fish and chips....on the Wharf, I dont even know how thats possible.

tRMMRfpbMnkJEV__QmpK7g.review_text: I miss the hash browns and the simpler menu but... they're on their way to making something nice here.  Pluses:  Exceptional decor that remains casual while hinting at elegance.  Neat!                Staff.  Polished, sweet, attentive.  Heck, fed my meter for me!  Minuses:  Breakfast.  Oh boy - needs work.  Underdone potatoes and very plain eggs benedict - sad looking little thing on a huge fancy white plate... :(  Summary:  Management jumped all over my feedback via the server that the breakfast was a downer.  She asked me to tell her about my overall experience, I did.  Pluses and minuses - then said it doesn't add up if the food isn't well prepared.  She said the effort went into the lunch and dinner re-vamp, but that she'd send feedback up the line immediately.  Then she comp'd my sad little breakfast (good latte) and asked me to come back and try lunch or dinner with bar bites.  I have a coupon for one free appie - more incentive to try them again.  No, I'm not that easily bribed.  But her response was spot on, and her challenge to ask me to try again was smart on her part.  All in all.. a work in progress.  But the place LOOKS amazing.  And the staff is genuinely well trained and gracious.  Oh how I love to find places in the city where they actually train staff, or where staff are innately gracious.  I'll try again and update...  This place bears no relation to its former self, really...  Which is good.  Except for the potatoes - Jaysus, man...  How hard is it to roast potato wedges???
